data.text:
Thiruvanaikkaval (Trichy) - Appu Sthalam (Water)

Thiruvanaikaval Jambukeswarar Temple is situated on the bank of river Cavery,and 2 kms east of Srirangam, near in Trichy. This temple is one of the very biggest stone temple in tamilnadu. Five Pragarams, Many Gopurams Lot of Sannidhis are found in this temple. A lot of sculpture wonders are present in temple's stone pillars, Rishabavaganar, Durga, Lord Muruga, Ganapathy, Ruthran Sculpture are very much attracted by tourist peoples.

Lord Jumbukeswarar(sivan)sitting under the tree of Jambu (naval tree).Sri Agilandeswari amman worship the lord Shiva by the form of water lingam in the bank of cavery river in Kritha Yugam. The Water lingam became a stone Lingam. The goddess Agilandeswari Statue is very beatiful,Spirutual wonder. She wear the ear ring called "Thadangam" is given by Adhi Sankarar. This temple Outer wall is built by Lord Shiva (hindu name of - Thiruneerittan Mathil 8000 feet long, 32 feet heith). The Sivalingam is partially submerged by water ever and meant to represent God form as water. Similarly as kalahasthi,a spider, and elephant who were devotees of the Lord Shivan in here, and get mukthi from lord Shiva. The temple is named Thiru Anai(Elepahant) Kaval (prevent) after the elephant which is believed to have worshipped Lord Siva here.

Thevara Moovar(Three Poets wrote to Lord Shiva, the big volume of poetry book is named Thevaram) Thirunavukkarasar, Sambandhar, Sundarar Visit this temple and sung the Pathigam. In Sixteenth century the Great hindu poet Kavi Kalamegam blessed by Sri Agilandeswari amman, then he became a great poet. Temple tree is White Jumbu Tree(Naval Tree)
